summary: In response to COVID-19 , Congress created the Paycheck Protection Program to help small businesses get low-interest loans. But self-employed people and businesses owned by minorities, women, and veterans faced challenges getting loans, prompting the Small Business Administration to: approve 600 new lenders-including nonbanks, who largely didn't participate in the first round of the program develop guidance to encourage more self-employed people to apply Also...
title: Paycheck Protection Program: Program Changes Increased Lending to the Smallest Businesses and in Underserved Locations
